basic.description: This course is intended for students at both the Masters and Doctoral levels, who have a technical background in exploration geology, mining engineering or mineral processing, but are interested in understanding the sustainability aspects, issues and controversies surrounding mineral exploration and resource development.  It describes the evolution of policies, operational procedures and management systems related to sustainability and the social, economic, environmental, ethical, and technical design challenges facing the mining industry.  Course material will be presented through lectures, special presentations, classroom and on-line discussion and self-directed study and readings.  Marking for the course will be assessed on the basis of student assignments, written reports and presentations.
basic.subject: MINE
basic.title: Advanced Topics in Mining Sustainability
